Images and Movies produced by PETSc libraries and applications

See Acknowledgments for software packages that PETSc uses.

PETSc has been used for modeling in all of these areas: Acoustics, Aerodynamics, Air Pollution, Arterial Flow, Bone Fractures, Brain Surgery, Cancer Surgery, Cancer Treatment, Carbon Sequestration, Cardiology, Cells, CFD, Combustion, Concrete, Corrosion, Data Mining, Dentistry, Earth Quakes, Economics, Esophagus, Fission, Fusion, Glaciers, Ground Water Flow, Linguistics, Mantel Convection, Magnetic Films, Material Science, Medical Imaging, Ocean Dynamics, Oil Recover, PageRank, Polymer Injection Molding, Polymeric Membrances, Quantum computing, Seismology, Semiconductors, Rockets, Relativity, Surface Water Flow.

Due to the large number of publications that use PETSc we can no longer maintain a database of such publications. Please see citations at scholar.google.com and other citations at scholar.google.com for recent publications. The list below is only of older publications and kept for historical reasons.

  • Applications of SLEPc (the eigenvalue package built on PETSc)
  • Applications of libMesh (the finite element package built on PETSc)
  • Applications of MOOSE (the simulation framework built on PETSc and libMesh)
